description: Students not only investigate the theory of modern analytical chemistry, but also examine the
statistical treatment of errors, equilibrium, activities, acid/base chemistry, spectroscopy,
electrochemistry, and separations. The accompanying lab course, Chemistry 256, illustrates the
topics discussed in Chemistry 255. Students taking this course use computers for solving
problems. Prerequisite: Chemistry 126 or Chemistry/Biology 127 or permission of the instructor.
Concurrent registration in Chemistry 256 is required.  Offered both semesters.
